snippet: White House officials are struggling to make good on President Obama’s promise that Americans can keep their insurance coverage without undermining the new health law or adding unaffordable costs.
abstract: Obama administration, under intense bipartisan pressure to answer mounting complaints about botched health care rollout, is struggling to make good on promise that Americans can keep their insurance coverage without undermining new health law or adding unaffordable costs; Obama strongly opposes calls from across political spectrum, including from former Pres Bill Clinton, to support legislation allowing people to keep current insurance plans.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ROBERT PEAR
byline.contributor: Sharon LaFraniere contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: White House officials are struggling to make good on President Obama’s promise that Americans can keep their insurance coverage without undermining the new health law or adding unaffordable costs.

headline.main: Obama in Bind Trying to Keep Health Law Vow
headline.print_headline: Obama in Bind Trying to Keep Health Law Vow

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
